author: franzoni
body: #### PR description: + improvements and extensions to handle of HGCAL end-of-life scenario . improvements to the ageing mode (tools to toggle on/off different ingredients) . fix for the treatment of the common noise, set minimum charge collection efficiency to 0 + tool to apply realistic noise/gain setting also to startup scenarios ( `SLHCUpgradeSimulations/Configuration/python/aging.py:realisticHGCalStartup` ) + easier to handle also in startup scenarios (reshuffling `HGCalSiNoiseMap::getSiOpCharacteristics`) in this PR the startup scenario is not touched, only tools prepared for the next PR + HGCSample: . bits allocation changed to 12 bits reserved for data Data ( see HGC TDR page 161: adc mode only needs 10, ToT instead needs 12); 4 newly reserved for gain (currently only 3 gains used; 12 are technically possible and may be used) . boolean `toaFired_` removed, one bit reserve to it #### PR validation: Occupancies (only pileup, average 200) : ![radialprofile_counts_CEE_5_ps_gf](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4729828/68221990-97757c00-ffea-11e9-81e2-2e00829aaa13.png) at end-of-life with these improvements have been validated against a simple analytical model which, starting form the sole occupancy of in-time hits w/o noise, predicts the extra occupancy stemming from noise and from out of time pileup. Comparing pred and FS (full-sim) in the last four columns of the table supports the validity of the occupancies form this PR These updated occupancies and the validation model have been presented at the HGCAL DPG see [here](https://indico.cern.ch/event/855542/contributions/3602119/). #### if this PR is a backport please specify the original PR: This PR is not a back-port @pfs @deguio
title: HGCAL digitisation: end-of-life updates, more realism for startup
